intro: Boechera koehleri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Boechera koehleri has small, pinnately divided leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and genetic diversity.
